{"post_stream":{"posts":[{"id":3140861,"name":"joemost","username":"joemost","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/joemost/{size}/11114_2.png","created_at":"2023-02-06T21:17:03.446Z","cooked":"

My team is using a telescoping arm in a single joint!

Meaning if we stick our arm straight up, we can telescope extwnd ourselves straight into breaking a envelope rule! Our arm can only be a certain length extended.

Has anyone had any success implimenting a model or concept to constrain this for them in software?

We have been thinking about some homegrown solutions, but from reading around and teams talking about using common approaches for example, a double jointed arm…it makes me think there has to be a way to avoid reinventing the wheel!

Also makes me wonder if there are any ultiility classes in wpilib for doing this exact thing! Any help would be huge!

edu.wpi.first.math.trajectory.constraint
It still might require some inventing, this looks close to what your trying to do.
Specifically the RectangularRegionConstraint

I okay I see how you did that. very interesting, that arm legal variable.

I guess in a way I’m overcomplicating this, know where the Arms heading and if its going to be illegal do something about it!

Trying to understand whag the terminolgy for this type of system would be in control theory.

Basically if the arm is going over the robot it is constrained by a max height. If the heighest point is when the angle is 0, then a constraint should be the telescoping arm must be at its absolute minimum length.

If the angle is say + or - 5, maybe the telescoping arm is allowed to have some more length.

The beauty of this system is you could potentially maximize your motion. While you move your arms rotation, you could get a jump on you extension target for you know how long you could make it.

Struggling to figure out currently how to maximize that potentially. Not sure if its a feedforward thing. Im basically trying to connect two systems (both already using their own control system via Talons)

@calcmogul and @Oblarg Do you guys have any ideas? I only ask because you’re control theory wizards/wpilib wizards! Currious if you have any thoughts or if there are WPILIB capabilities I should be taking advantage of. Right now its just two motion control systems operating indepdently.

yup! thats the unelegant way now.

Basically if I want to rotate the arm over the top of the robot, I check the telescoping arm extension length, and force it to pull in before I allow it to rotate over.

Honestly I’m more just curious if theres a more elegant/smarter way to control it

joemost:

Honestly I’m more just curious if theres a more elegant/smarter way to control it

Configuration spaces and a pathfinding algorithm like A* or informed RRT*. See chapter 16 of https://file.tavsys.net/control/controls-engineering-in-frc.pdf.
